He was super attentive and we all felt like we couldn't have gotten any better service!  A+++ and not only was our waiter awesome - the food was delicious!

wGvKwvKj3k7Ub8RmQXtOiQ.text: Great pizza! This was a delicious option inside our hotel. The dough was just how i like it on the crispier side, thin, and the toppings had a fresh and authentic taste.  Our waiter was comical, wearing a pink tutu for a cause and recommending some truly delicious items on the menu.   This is a simple place (they do not sell by the slice sadly). It's a place made just for pizza. Which brings me to how disappointed I was to learn that they did not sell wings or garlic knots.  Overall a good recommendation for pizza and in close proximity if you're staying at the Palazzo or Venitian.

RLC3deyDW_CdQA83gvk24A.text: The original Grimaldi's, nestled under the Brooklyn Bridge since 1990, has serious pizza heritage. Patsy Grimaldi mentored under Gennaro Lombardi, the grand-daddy of NY pizza, back in the early 20th Century, then went out on his own, first up in Harlem. Grimaldi built his rep on using coal-fired ovens to get a crispy burnt charcoal taste into the bottom of the crust. New Yorkers used to stand in line to get into Grimaldi's, as they took no reservations. Zagat once crowned it the best pizza in the city.  Alas, all that isn't going to mean very much with regard to your non-Brooklyn experience at a Grimaldi's Pizzeria.   I was excited at the possibilities that awaited, what with the combination of The Palazzo's commitment to upscale excellence with the Grimaldi's name. I fronted my pizza with a Caesar salad that I can say was tasty enough. However my loaded pie was pretty durn bland. And having eaten NY pizza ... since I was a kid in NY back-in-the-day from pizzerias where everyone working in the joint all spoke thick Italian and zero English ... I think I've earned the right to say that. Those pizzas didn't have crisped-up bottoms -- and you know what -- I prefer it soft, doughy and chewy, thank you very much. The top of the pizza also left much to be desired. Soggy, slippery-sloppy, too flippy-floppy, lacking those little drops of grease that bring on the flavor. I've had LOTS of NY-style pizza that I liked much more than this. In fact, I've had slices of pizza in the all-night food court area on The Venetian side of this property that was better. (Highway-robbery prices at 4am, a packed mob of drunk millennials chowing-down shoulder-to-shoulder, but still better pizza.) I felt like they had just turned a bunch of minnie-wage kids with zero oven experience loose in a Grimaldi's to try to figure out how to make pizza. When it was over, I toted my sad Grimaldi's pizza box back to the car and my fridge. Now keep in mind that even the worst pizza is, to co-opt a concept from Woody Allen, is still right-on-the-money. But I sure won't be back here for seconds.  The source of this mediocrity, I have now discovered, is that the Grimaldi family actually sold off their name and the business back in 1998 ... and the new owner has been working to turn Grimaldi's into a major franchise ever since. Want in? It'll cost you at least a cool million. Currently there's 13 Grimaldi franchises just in Vegas. One right across the street in the Fashion Show Mall. Yes, now we're talking shopping mall pizza here. And other franchises as far flung as Shanghai.   Put all of it together and it makes makes Grimaldi's sound a whole lot more like Papa John's  ... and a whole lot less like the wide-spread distribution of legendary NY pizza. Meanwhile the Grimaldi family, having long ago sold off their own name, are now running another pizzeria in Brooklyn named Juliana's Pizza, a joint that somehow has ties running back to the Lombardi family. THAT being where New Yorkers in-the-know stand in-line these days for their pizza. The tourists, apparently, line-up at Grimaldi's.  Given my experience and that history, I'd say don't buy into the legend of the Grimaldi brand - a legend that is truly no-more - and use your belly to gather up other Vegas culinary experiences instead. Some of which can be had right on The Venetian/Palazzo property.

hhAF05VIajGxiv4N2ClzfA.text: This is for the pizza I ordered. It was not good at all. I ordered 16" pizza: A half pizza with tomato, tomato sauce, mushrooms, black olives & pepperoni and the other half was margherita. The dough was chewy, and not cooked 100%. Tomato sauce was runny and had no flavor. I had to ask for salt to add flavor. By far the "nastiest" pizza I have ever tasted!   I should've sent it back, but I had eaten one slice. We came here because it was convenient, since we were staying at the Palazzo. I regretted it and will not come back.

So unprofessional very disappointed we drove this way just to leave.

Fa6N8DllWMd8t1n8S28Sdw.text: We ate here as a family of 3 (Palazzo location) Service was friendly and efficient from the word go. We had 2 16" pizzas to share. The base and sauce were perfect. We had meatballs as a topping and really enjoyed it. All staff effortlessly made sure we had a great experience, we will go back next time we're in town.

k9c9RpSKvbSMy-5EFUKACA.text: We decided on some tasty pizza to go with our great selection of beers we had set for the 4th of July celebration. We ordered two pizza's, one 18 inch with sausage, pepperoni and meatball. The pizza sauce was tasty and plentiful.   The second pizza was a 12 inch veggie with tomatoes, olives, onion and mushroom. Excellent pizza as well and when the dust had settled not a single piece was left. Just the right amount of pizza for our hungry appetites.

Askb3T_4yFA7MuCZhNuYZg.text: One of the best pizzas I tried in Las Vegas. Has a unique taste and worthy of eating anytime you want some good pizza. Definitely give it a try if you are a pizza aficionado.

mskqo95m01p_saWk49Bv9A.text: The hotel Bellman recommended and it did not disappoint! AMAZING pizza. We tried the white pizza and the All meat Don. Both were served hot, flavorful and filling. Katie our waitress was phenomenal! She made great recommendations that were spot on. Great food and great service! Will definitely be back.

qWK_T7zGqa0Kpll-UAqKmA.text: Athena is the best GM. She's very friendly, personable and amazing. She knows how to handle anything and is such a joy to be around.

JbjEyq6f2qvBxRe91bPCww.text: Nice place for a lunch break. Pizzas are their thing but they have salads and other choices. We picked a 12" pizza with pepperoni. It was good but awfully salty. Kind of surprising.

LyfMGEMnoSKr8chLwWWMgg.text: A life saver when you're looking for a real late night bite. Few places around the Venetian (that's not the cafe) are open this late. So when the food court closes and you're stumbling around; it's hard to find a better option.   Even for Vegas, the prices are a little high. Tho I assume most of their customers don't really mind that. I was in such need of a hot meal I would have paid even more.   The pizza is good. It's a mix of Neapolitan and NY. The crust is one of the best parts, and they do not skimp on the basil.

_NccYfQjTc0bAA3gdz2Fhw.text: Amazing pizza and great service. We have already recommended this place to our friends. Definitely sign up for their email alerts on their website to get five dollars off instantly and a free pizza on your birthday.

IMA82rhvAA63smix5coCng.text: Located in the Fashion Show Mall, Grimaldi's Pizzeria is a cute little Italian Pizzeria that's pretty quick with the service.   One member of our party dined in solo and we came later and placed a to-go order. We were in and out within a matter of 15 minutes. It serves up Italian food, has a bar, and a variety of pizzas to choose from...what's not to like?!   The staff we encountered were all pleasant and helpful. When we reached our destination and tasted our food, we all agreed the pizza was really great. It's a great place to stop in and unwind or grab a bite to-go.

JUPJ-L978V1NJZzA6m3EKw.text: I'm a bit of a pizza snob, but it turns out we have half a dozen pizza places in Vegas that are special... Grimaldi's is one of them.... consistent quality!   Their sausage, pepperoni, mushroom pizza is my go to order and it is always perfect! The combination of their sauce and the quality toppings is splendid! Nirvana!   Don't worry! It will be worth the calories! Plus their salads are tasty as well! I like the Fashion Show Mall location. All that shopping makes me hungry! Ha!   ps. I was raised in the pizza business and I know the difference.

k59booPlDkNYKl-Dp0HzPw.text: Still the best pizza in Vegas! Never come to Vegas without having dinner here. The service is fast and friendly and food is always amazing.

vaaw72YQwAiwRZ2Qutqzmw.text: Don't get delivery unless you want it cold as if it sat in a fridge overnight. Called management they said "sorry can't do anything about it, contact uber". I did, uber won't correct my order either. Cold pizza, great Saturday night for $38 thanks for nothing.

4GR18votXIjxMyd2VqckYQ.text: Came in at last call hoping to get a couple of pies. Bartender was eager to take our orders plus drinks. He was very nice and took care of biz . Can't thank him enough!  Pizza was awesome.

rMYJXJgeEUuKgW4_8kkiFg.text: Came for a dinner after a conference. I had to wait less than 10 minutes for my table, but as they send you a text to let you know when it's ready, you can visit some shops around the restaurant until you get the text. Prices are good and the sizes of the pizzas are big. The service was good and even the manager was helping with the orders. The pizza was perfectly balanced with the sauce and the toppings (I got the Brooklyn Bridge).Highly recommended.

xe78s7pe5J01Ax8uYXfFNw.text: Grimaldi's pizza is probably one of the best pizzas I've eaten in awhile!  I love pigging out during vacation and luckily it was just my sister's birthday.  She had a coupon for a free pizza so we printed it out and presented it to them.  This was for one large pizza with one free topping!  Additional toppings range from $2-$5 depending on what you get.  We got pepperoni and mushrooms! yum!!  This large pizza is $16 and it is worth it, even if we didn't have a coupon.  I love thin pizzas so if you are not a fan and want more thickness, you may not like it.  They make these pizzas with fresh mozzarella cheese and you can see them make it through their glass windows. Andddd  i must say, this pizza was GINORMOUS!! We had to take 2 slices to go. We also ordered the Antipasto, which consisted of genoa salami, fresh mozzarella, oven-roasted sweet peppers, sicilian olives, and oven toasted crostini.  This was $9 for a regular size.  This was just an okay salad dish.  All this and only one basil leaf? :(  Overall, I love this place.  It is located in Venetian/Palazzo hotel.  Very nice decor and a great place for a date too!  I was so hungry later that night that I ate the leftovers...COLD and i must say, it was still delicious! Our server was super polite and very helpful too!  NOTE: -Sign up for email to get a free pizza on your birthday -MUST print out coupon and present (they do not take from phones)

Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. antipasto
Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1uYuwKQwl2MdkubCLfcyTQ.text: We were wandering around the Venetian/Palazzo complex looking for a place to grab dinner. There are a ton of good options, but we were looking for something quick and relatively cheap. We almost settled for the food court inside the Grand Canal Shoppes ($10 ish dollars per person), but luckily we opted for something better.   Grimaldi's is located near the Wynn pedestrian bridge entrance to the Palazzo. It's on the upper level with Palazzo's shopping area. We were quickly seated in the main dining room, which had an open look into the pizza kitchen where you can see the cooks baking your coal fired pizzas. We ordered a large pizza (18" - 8 slices) with Italian sausage and mushrooms. The pizza was very tasty - I particularly liked the flavorful sausage and the red sauce.   The large size is $16, with each additional topping ranging from $2-$4. We got one pizza with two toppings to share so our total bill came out to be around $21 without tip, which is less than we would have paid at the food court!!! Moral of this story: skip the food court and get some real food in a nice relaxed atmosphere at Grimaldi's!

lNONj-_XjMjjdQKlkLiNEQ.text: Seriously the best pizza I've ever had. Service was great & our server was very sweet & patient while I took awhile to make my final decision.

photos.caption: Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caprese Salad
Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Brooklyn Bridge with fresh Garlic....AMAZING!!

rO_KAQRuAdMBPcNwtR2vyg.text: This place was absolutely incredible. We came here for the free birthday pizza and we were so impressed. We also ordered a Cesar salad and it as well was extremely good.   I LOVE pizza and this place was one of the best pizzas I've ever had. We only got pepperoni but it was huge for one thing, the cheese was great and everything about our experience was pleasant and delicious. Can't wait to go back for someone else's birthday!

photos.caption: Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. one slice of our large pepperoni pizza and a scoop of our large Caesar salad

4hMkj6fxMmAu1XePKUEvew.text: I love Grimaldi's and I'm definitely a frequent flyer here whenever I crave for pizza. Fresh, extremely fresh pizza, made to order, and THIN crust. I'm a huge fan of thin crust pizza!! Also for less than $20 you get a quality pizza!  I read that they bake their pizza using brick ovens, but with a special kind of coal called "anthracite" which is a more premium coal because it has a high carbon content and few impurities.   & since they originated in NYC and wanted to bring the same flavor to other cities, they do not use our water system here in the LV valley- instead they use the NYC water pumping system installed in every location to bring that flavor here.   First I will say, that the service at this location was a little below what I'm used to, normally get my pizza lightly cooked on the crust, because they normally bring it out a a little charred. I requested it but still got the charred crust. :(  If you like a little buttery crust, I recommend asking for it lightly cooked.   We order our pizza with basil (you can get it baked on top or after baking, so it's still "raw," with pepperoni, and with italian sausage. Extra toppings of course cost a little more.   I haven't tried their desserts yet, since this location is in the palazzo, Bouchon bakery is soo close. So I ran right over there. :P  4/5 stars- because of the service at this location. Otherwise 5 stars for the awesomeness of the pizza!

NnYHkUlNjwYfo5Lf_5J0bA.text: The best pizza I've ever had in my life. Not an exaggeration. I had it last year in Vegas, and went back a few weeks ago just to see if my memory was correct. It was indeed.  My friend and went shopping the next day and came upon another Grimaldi's at the big mall nearby. So we had it yet again.  Yup 2 days in a row. That location wasn't quite as good as this one at the Palazzo, but still great. This location however is stellar on quality.  I can't disagree with someone on taste, since it's subjective- but to the people that say they've had better pizza...for the love of god tell me where that is. No words, just go. Oh, and don't go all fancy. Just the pepperoni. Keep it nice and pure.

ABJsxOm_fWMaEnfQfTKNLg.text: The pizza here was delicious! I got a personal pizza with mushrooms and pepperoni. Everything tasted fresh, the sauce was great, the dough was thin but flavorful and the cheese seemed and tasted like a high quality mozzarella. I enjoyed the dining room set up as well. We sat close the the oven and watched them spinning and tossing pizza. The wine selection was good as well. We opted for a lower end bottle($21) and were pleasantly surprised when it was good(it was Stella Merlot). To top everything off, our waitress was on point as well. All in all, this place was awesome! Give them a try if you haven't already

ZWPz1XoQtHmYz_s7NzSO5Q.text: Get the personal pizza, not the medium/large. If you do some nerdy calculation, you get less for your money when you get anything larger than a single pizza.   Pizza was flavorful (but what pizza isn't?) and a personal pizza is enough to split between two girls. I didn't find this pizza to be super amazing or anything. I'd much rather go to the secret pizza place at the Cosmo.  This is a good place if you want something relatively quick, easy, and affordable.

xTHF3VPpF45wnLFM3TfkEw.text: Damon is awesome server and Italian sausage with onions large pizza is beyond amazing!  Barbera red wine from Italy is phenomenal for only 28 a bottle!

photos.caption: Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Excellent wine from Italy for only 28 dollars!!

1MdTqfnQhYKdazIGJz9U0A.text: 3.5 stars because of the service. Okay servers just because your tips aren't pool doesn't mean you can treat the tables you're not serving horribly. Giolani or whatever his name is was the older server who looked he hated his life. When I asked him if he could reheat my pizza because it was cold, he just looked at me, kept walking, and shook his head yes. Waited another 5 minutes for him to come back and never saw him again.   So the FOOD...  we ordered the mediterranean salad which was delish! We ordered a large between two people and ate it all just fine with no struggle. I loved the sauce they used because it was your normal vinaigrette but it had a nice tangy sour kick to it!   Finally after 20 minutes we received the pizza because they had to clean the ovens in the middle of the day. It was only warm. I don't about you but I love my pizza burning the roof of my mouth when I take my first bite. By the time i went for my second slice it was cold.

9yI25SdPh3ihz0Q4X6NIPQ.text: Fell in love with Grimaldi's in 2003 at the original Brooklyn bridge location. Always a bit disjointed when an original goes the franchise route but they do a good job keeping the quality at this vegas location. Recommend the pepperoni.

cVowMMQXWjkZrEvNmLc3Ww.text: Amazing!  Try the personal cheese pizza topped with ricotta!  Amazing creamy deliciousness!  Also tiramisu is to die for!   Will be back!

LlOcU-idn0F9tP-cYoYdoA.text: Disappointing this time. Waitress was less than friendly. The pizza was lacking in the 2 sides we ordered.  The amount of sausage was miniscule. This was not the pizza we were used to at this restaurant . The wine was good but way overpriced for the small serving. The pizza itself was not the usual. Perhaps it was the holiday that influenced the. Poor quality.

Kg1TTBrNj_in2dO7KhhQ9w.text: A big group of friends came here after a long day of drinking for a bachelor party.  I was amazed that most of us were still standing and that we found this place hidden in a mall in Las Vegas.  The food here was good and the pizza was tasty.  We got a couple of pizzas and both had really good flavor and the crust was good too.

pH_fH5CuUyfO6nLYjDOlPQ.text: Super delicious!! First we walked in and sat right away which was excellent since we had just got off our flight and were ready to eat. Our server was Victor and he was great! Very prompt, brought us a menu right away, and we were able to decide what we wanted right away. We ordered a large pizza with mushroom, meatball and bacon. The starter large pizza was $18 and each topping was extra. There were tons of toppings anywhere between $2-$4. We were served our pizza within about 10 minutes which is fast for cooked to order. A large pizza was quite a bit for two people but we managed to eat all but two pieces which we took out for later. We also each got a soda and with tax it totalled up to $34.00 which is really great for two super stuffed people who won't need to eat again for hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So full!

87ixvr2jxmbhURo-i_vNbA.text: We eat here a lot! I love the people, they remember your face and that's always welcoming. Pizza  was awesome and I've never had a bad meal here. It's perfect...cheap and wonderfully clean!

LVdAxX0udwix_E7kR1xF_Q.text: Absolutely fantastic!  One of the best pizzas I have had.  Very light and crispy, perfect sauce, excellent toppings and wonderful servers.  They have a good wine list and very good salads as well.  I love the location of this spot in the Palazzo.  Not crowded which makes for a lovely dining experience.

65X0HoN5MWHjA1fuZrS8Iw.text: Delicious!!   I guess I should elaborate beyond my one word statement. We went to Grimaldi's for lunch on our second day in Vegas. This was our first time and won't be our last.   Our waitress was Selina and she awesome. She made sure to explain to us how the menu works and what they were known for. She also warned us that their portions are huge and are meant to be shared, family style. I really appreciated her advising us because when on vacation I hardly eat left overs and I hate wasting food.   My husband and I shared the small Mediterranean salad and small traditional pizza (toppings: ricotta cheese, pepperoni, sausage and jalepanos). Since it was early for us we decided not to drink any alcohol but I did check out their wine list and it is extensive and very reasonably priced.   I know Vegas is not cheap but this place is probably a great way to stretch your money and have high quality food.   Two thumbs up for Grimaldi's food and to our server Selina.

3UDORpCRXLqi8xfPJg3fNA.text: I think that was the best pizza I've ever had. The sauce was outstanding and the cheese is wonderful. I got a large with pepperoni, mushroom, onion. One of my favorite combinations.   Also, go around 4-5 to get there before the crowds.

photos.caption: Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OjvAAasTzzVtMkCa6Kjkcw.text: Delicious! We ordered a small pizza, which is great for two people. Half cheese, half pepperoni. I ate the entire cheese side, like a fatty. I ordered a half pint of wine, let me tell you, that's enough for two people. However, I ended up drinking all of it!  During my visit, the Venetian performers came around and sang to everyone, encouraging us to visit the show in St. Marks Square. I love the Palazzo and enjoy coming up to the shops, with so many unique restaurants and retailers, it's always a good time.

RqrHXB6LTAUArUqwAkaGkQ.text: Best pizza I have ever eaten.  Really wanted to eat there twice on my trip to Vegas but never made it back.  I visit Vegas twice a year and make it a point to eat here.  The service was excellent.  I probably won't waste my time on a salad again and just eat more pizza!  There was nothing wrong with it just that it was nothing spectacular.

TFnMkpmjMhUCVhTDmXKeAw.text: Stopped in here late after a show.   For 20.00 each we had 3 small pizzas with toppings, 2 soda's, a beer and a glass of wine!  And it was not crowded at all.   The line for the original is around the block in Brooklyn and we had wait but it was just as good.    and a 4.00 glass of wine??   Unheard of in Vegas!  Would go back but try some others out first.  NY is closer for me but i do like no wait!

sq_E8BsZrr52xxIsvhwO_A.text: Without a doubt, one of the best pizzas I have ever had. We started off with the Antipasto for appetizer, fresh sliced bread with salami, olives, roasted bell peppers and fresh mozzarella. We then had the large pesto pizza with ricotta, tomatoes and sausage. Amazing meal and reasonably priced.

mMFrtkUQj9Z672QeVni-yw.text: Tasteless sauce, bland cheese, somehow they made the garlic bland, I have no idea how one does that.  Someone should introduce the chef to salt. Crust was good.  If you're drunk, this is easily a 5 star place. Although someone sitting here with me that also dined there disagrees, saying that even if she were drunk, it would be tasteless.

htR32tFcqRw2EEdIinVGcw.text: LOVE Grimaldi's!!!  Order is always right and staff is always great.  One complaint is that bathroom isn't family friendly.

6xM6qkhu6jXeCVK8dO39eA.text: Great pizza the service was great. You should definitely try the NY cheese cake very light and creamy .

gq16oivzZnfpxB70mqywBw.text: best pizza i ever tasted...AMAZING.....and i just got the pepperoni.....i wish i would've put more on it.............really goood

ayL6EUCS-IP4tSqIgecXYQ.text: Excellent Pizza! @ Shoppes at the Palazzo Venetian Hotel Location. Highly recommend thisn New York style pizza! Visited one of their restaurants in NYC and this must better! LOL! You can get half and half pizzas too! The ricotta cheese is amazing! Excellent service. Resonable priced! Hard to get too so call ahead and get good directions! Otherwise you have to walk through all of the shops and keep asking for directions!

jTT_dXs3A26OJFX-nj7r2w.text: My first time at Grimaldi's ever, and it was terrible. First, the place wasn't really that busy, but my husband and I were told it would be a 10-15 minute wait. 20 minutes later, we were seated. After taking our drink order, it took our waiter about another 20 minutes to get my one glass of wine to me. For dinner, we ordered one large pizza to share and a small salad for me. After 30 minutes, the waiter stopped by for the first time since dropping my wine off to get my husband's Pepsi refill, at which point he mentioned my salad to the waiter. He looked at his notepad, and replied with "Oh, that's right. Sorry about that, I'll be right back." He completely forgot about it. About 10 minutes later, the waiter came to us to tell us the kitchen staff burned our pizza, so we'd have to wait another 10-15 minutes to allow them to finish the second pizza. My salad was better than the pizza. I don't know what all the hype is because I've had better frozen pizzas than what they made. To top it all off, it was half-price Tuesday, and we were charged full price for my glass of wine. My second worst restaurant service experience of all time.

0bS5qDlOMoV-y95YnzLLFQ.text: Just returned from a trip to Palazzo in Vegas, so decided to try the newest Grimaldi's.The food is delicious, consistent, and large portions, even when ordering the small sizes. My husband is crazy about Grimaldi's, and was impressed by this location. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because service was slow, and the restaurant was not busy, but had lots of employees.

HxyWIVxvY8zHNVRCtnoW6A.text: We visited Las Vegas in August and happened into Grimaldi's for the first time.  We were impressed with everything!  The food and service were the best we've had in Las Vegas in a long time (in a casual setting).  The staff was genuinely welcoming and engaged, and the general manager, Fred, even came over to our table when we had a question with the wine.  The pizza and salads were so good that we ate at the restaurant a second time before we left town.  We really appreciated having a good meal late -- many of the nice restaurants don't serve after 11 pm on the weekends, and we didn't even pop in until about that time.  This restaurant is on our short list for next time we visit Vegas in October.  Great job, guys!

eHeObRRbVHzIHlsBvgWEGg.text: Just had a pizza here with my family.  I ordered a pepperoni pizza for my kids and me and my wife spit the Brooklyn.  Our pizza was very bland and I had to put on bunch of Parmesan cheese and hot pepper to give it some flavor.  They had a single server for an entire section and was it slow!  They need to hire another person or buy that girl some roller skates.  Worse, my beer was not cold (but I still drank it all :P)...  I used a gift card to pay and they said my balance was zero, which was incorrect as I know I had over one hundred dollars on it.  I put the tip on the gift card and made a note to check my balance.  They charged me $3 more on the tip!!!  Not enough to go back and complain but still, the service was sub-par and food not very good, so I WILL be disputing it with VISA.

aHwONk6YdSAcCRqe1kL2ZQ.text: We were visiting Vegas and found this place on Yelp. Went there on Friday night and found a packed house with little waiting was was great. Let me make it ease.  Best Pizza I have ever had (I used to own a pizza place) Very good service Prices were very reasonable for what you get.  PIZZA WAS AWESOME.

fil7RNxlJGQ4EbeIAYr_rA.text: Good crust and quality toppings...not bad at all.

Hdn_7rmOdb9-mHyUuOypmw.text: Amazing! JUST like the Manhatten location!

-Qh7mVPSaG-m2CDhfKBjBw.text: Perfect pizza and customization. Cesar salad kicked ass!

DIA7TnusfTGhgGyjjlCXbQ.text: I don't regularly eat pizza/cheese (due to lactose intolerance) but this place I will eat again. Pizza was delicious, and a salad should definitely be ordered alongside. Dessert, though very tempting, is not worth the money.

u__MG59Ux2p8QHo0jPkV4w.text: We came here twice during our stay at the Palazzo and it did not disappoint. I love the crust and texture of the pizza. Service was friendly and fast.

PVO7Xvhdi1p4ALGqKtVNhQ.text: This Grimaldi's location never disappoints. We love it. The salads and appetizers are always up to par. Pizza is never soggy. Cold, refreshing drinks as well. Decor is super cute and New York-style. Have tried their cannoli a few times and it was great. Wish there was a location this consistently good in Southern California. Anyway, we'll be back each time we visit Vegas. Always satisfied here.

1faJSEebEds_VuxBVTRaSw.text: I recently lived in NY for 3 years so I have been dying for this style of pizza. It is the best. Grimaldi's was great...so close to what I am used to in NY. Honestly, it was close enough. Great pizza. I will definitely be going back next time (and every time) I am in Vegas.

PFix4oO7ZkEjusstd_x1_Q.text: Great pizza, no doubt. Caprese Salad was probably my favorite. For some reason, they wanted to keep me out of the main restaurant area, even though it was basically empty: "Would you like to sit at the bar, the patio, out here in the hall"... really weird, I know I need a haircut, but come on! A little expensive for a personal pizza ($15) but I'd do it again.

08uqOc3h7GDxnO592BfSmg.text: Pizza was good, but didnt amaze.  Not a fan of those some sauce here, some cheese there type pizzas... prefer a more even spread.  My biggest gripe was the rip off upcharge of toppings... $2-$5 per topping.  $2 to add onions to your pizza??  On a positive their cheesecake was really good and their desert and drink menu was pretty decently priced.

bl8rdmTVPykqOmY_BQPocg.text: I've eaten at the original location on Front Street a couple of times, and this is just as good. I went to the one at the Fashion Show shopping center. Nice spot with big airy dining area and open kitchen. Great staff and still one of the best pizza's I have anywhere in the country. Found out from the server, they treat the water to add minerals to mimic the water used for the dough in NYC. If you have never had coal fire pizza, you really need too. The ovens are even hotter than wood fire and that results in an even better dough. They make pizza the correct way, without too much cheese and a balanced sauce (not too sweet). If you need your real NYC pizza fix, you can't do better in Las Vegas. Definitely worth going out of the way for if you are craving great pizza.

vzDlP7ZqZqu9Ntf7PnSSmg.text: Authentic New York style old world pizza - thin crust, light sauce & cooked to perfection. Open until midnight we went 4 late night snack. Been in Vegas many times but never tried pizza this is our new spot Great find!!!

Xnfb6nhQSrtM3-dbBH-OHg.text: Really delicious pizza: thin crust, NY, brick oven style. We shared the 18" large with half white w/garlic, quarter regular, and quarter pesto to try all the sauces. Toppings were bacon, sausage, and pepperoni. Nice wine selection and decent beers on draft. I'm sad that the closest one to us is in Vegas from L.A. Very reasonable for a sit down restaurant on the strip. Didn't have the room, but they had cannoli, cheesecake, and tiramisu for dessert. Would definitely go again the next time we are in Vegas! If you're staying at one of the Grazie hotels, check your coupon book for 15% off

ZWwdTjlm2FjN4rSjvSKtnQ.text: I love this place.  Great thin crust pizza as good as it gets

toeIazeMY-6Dp2QCvEEf1w.text: wierd pizza, tomato sauce on the top, cheese on the bottom, the cold tomato gravy ruins the pizza, paid my bill and left most of the pizza, if i wasn't starving would have left all of it.

etgFUUsdES9lNko6oNBZew.text: Didn't even get to eat there because I called at 10:59 and they closed at 11 (after a previous call to them and they said we could come in last minute- otherwise I would never do that to the waitstaff) and the girl on the phone- in the pipsqueakiest girl voice was like "I mean, if you run here in the next minute then whatever-Iike, if you can get here in time..." No sympathy, no hospitality - and ps? In no world am BOLTING through the Palazzo so I can make some 21 year old hostesses' time clock. Bad attitude on that girl- we get you wanna go home, don't take it out on us- especially when your coworker said it was cool. She sucked.

f_OPJ2AvXZ-UOHUqLW2vYQ.text: The husband and I stumbled onto Grimaldi's on our last trip to Vegas. It was so amazing that we ended up eating there twice during our trip (first at Fashion Show Mall, then at the Palazzo).   Grimaldi's has the best pizza I've ever eaten. The ingredients are top-notch. Fresh mozzarella, house-made sauce, delicious roasted red peppers. They make a decent ceasar salad as well (a small easily feeds 2 people, as an appetizer to a pizza). Great cannolis.   The location was super quiet when we were there (early dinnertime). At the back of the ultra-upscale Shops at the Palazzo, I'm guessing that this pizza joint isn't often busy. But the location is very nice and the restaurant's interior is new and casual, but still classy.  If you're in Vegas and looking for pizza, you MUST go to Grimaldi's.

Nvz-4cUntzumVPZLjwU6iw.text: Pizza was ok, decent size for a large one, but idk what all the hype is about since it was very much average in taste. I have definitely had better pizza very easily. Service was ok, but I took my pizza to go so I cannot say much about it. One major flaw: not enough cheese and each topping is at least $2 (but it is vegas, so no surprise about the pricing). Easily accessible is you are staying at the Palazzo.

b9Ei4Rr5Wt-A4DxQFKOGeQ.text: I grew up in Chicago so I am pretty picky about my pizza, but for a party of three we ordered one large pizza and an antipasti salad it it was the perfect amount of food and both were fantastic.

gnMrLAQFWNDXgyjiZ_9h4w.text: Best pizza I've ever had. Anytime I'm near a Grimaldi's, I have to stop. A staple on every visit to the Venetian.

hvE8vh5HPm9rkowYpxTJFQ.text: Great pizzeria to go with the kiddos after a long day at the Avengers station. Kids are given pizza dough to play with while waiting for their pizza. Great atmosphere and kid friendly

cRxBW5QzEE3Tz95-A_iKeg.text: We really enjoyed Grimaldi's Las Vegas. I love New York pizza and a coal oven is a big reason. We loved the salad for 4. It was just the right amount of dressing and good stuff. The antipasto platter was very good too. As for the pizza...while it's not real New York it was as close as I've had anywhere outside of NY. The sausage was fantastic and the bubbly, charred crust was one of the highlights. Love that stuff. They also made an Italian Margarita that was delicious and not too sweet. We got there a bit before 5 and had to wait for our pizza because they don't start the oven until 5. But that was a great move because we got a nice table in the patio area. At 5 when the ovens fired up the crowd rolled in quickly. The great salad, antipasto and Margaritas made the wait for the ovens a breeze.

photos.caption: Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half 4 cheese and half sausage and pepperoni. Good stuff

texVQiaZRt-tcyGClPEdbw.text: Extremely mediocre food for such high prices. got there early on a weeknight, there were four of us. We each had salad and a personal pizza.. the ambiance is extremely LOUD and the lighting is awful. It smells like institutional food when you first walk in. The pizza sauce had NO flavor, like it came out of a can. The toppings were not generous and the crust was mushy.  Maybe because I'm a New Yorker, I expected more.  The tab came to 130 bucks. not worth it

JN4fYqx--4SzHtZukZxNcA.text: Seriously just as good as the one under the Brooklyn bridge! I'm not kidding. When I want pizza in Vegas you better believe I am coming here! Get the margherita and the other one we had was some sort of meat lovers, I know it had meatballs on it and they were delicious. We also bad a veggie pizza a Cesar and a house salad, all very good. Service was great. Prices were decent since we split the total between our entire party. Can't wait to come back!

Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margherita

22lR9nEAWPvhEaIHBEyjAg.text: Friendly service, great food and fair prices. I was surprised that they have a location in El Segundo in California. Top quality ingredients and fast service. I would recommend to anyone hungry for pizza, salads and deserts.

photos.caption: Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dzGo0rAhfAJiesGHlS5AiQ.text: First time trying this pizza place inside palazzo.  It is actually pretty good!   We got a small pesto pizza (16inch) with pepperoni and sausage for $20 enough for the 3 of us to share.  The 18 inch is only $2 more but we don't want to have any leftover since we are staying at a hotel.   Service was ok...I did not expect much since it is only a pizza lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Only $20!

9hLyYA80pH7BkFy7Nf3Zpw.text: I think I've eaten here...oh...the past 3 times I've been to Vegas?! It's that good. Do yourself a favor and get the white pizza. I was a hater before, but now I've been converted :) Crunchy, crispy crust, with just enough chewiness. Excellent service! The waitress gave my MIL a lil canoli for her birthday, and she had rave reviews.

Zhd1unlVtLZvERM7vtw2LA.text: Great pizza for a thin, oven baked style.  Service has been great the last three times there.  Also, the portions are plentiful.  Don't miss a stop here if you're looking for some delicious artisan pizza and a beer or wine.  This place doesn't disappoint!!!

69RvaXR7xziaxAfKZz2Akg.text: Outstanding pizza! Outstanding service! Tony's recommednations were spot-on! The Caesar Salad was almost perfect -- just a bit too much croutons. A medium "The Don" was perfect for three adults. We only wish we had room for dessert! Very reasonably prices, this fairly large restaurant is tucked down a hallway in The Palazzo Las Vegas, so don't give up. It's definitely worth a look!

N8vTRXTl4mQzkveUkLherA.text: You can get a variety of great pizza in Vegas but this place has got to be one of them! It's located in the Palazzo near all the fancy shops. The restaurant itself lives up the standard of fancy Vegas. We were seated on the outside front of the restaurant. We got The Don, which had italian sausage on it. We also got a veggie pizza (forgot the name). What really stood out was the thin crust and amazing cheese. I could just taste the quality of the cheese. Love it when you bite into it and it stretches out until it breaks...mmmmm. The crust was thin but not soggy created the perfect base for our pizza.  We had leftovers and ate it on the car ride back to LA....it was still delicious!!!!

ZpyCQohsIvVO2VqQBH8JGg.text: Karen was our server tonight and she was on point with everything. The pizza was awesome and celebration for GEORGE's 21st birthday continued.

photos.caption: Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. George&#39;s 21&#39;st birthday continues.

gmZKvO1rlyXTf7w7itHghQ.text: Excellent NY style pizza someplace in the Venetian mall. The house salad is huge and filled with fresh vegetables and a tasty Italian dressing. The portions here are huge and two hungry people can easily split the small salad.  The pizza itself is the star, they use a coal fired oven which gives in a little bit of char and more crunch than many pizzas. The pizza has a sauce with a little bit of spice and doesn't need too much cheese. I had mushroom and black olives, the pizza was fresh, hot, and one of the best I've had. The 15 inch is plenty of food for two people. We had a salad and pizza and had about four slices left.   Service was very friendly and they did a good job giving this place the look and feel of a real NY pizzeria in the middle of a mall on the strip. This place is a must try for excellent pizza that won't break the bank.

photos.caption: Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slice of small mushroom and black olive pizza
Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small pizza with mushrooms and black olives, plenty to share
Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small salad is plenty for two to share

oLn-HCRKvx9zE2lUdVL5WA.text: This place was amazing. Talk about authentic Brooklyn pizza it's so yummy (original restaurant was started in New York). Based on a friends suggestion we came over to the Venetian to eat here. We were greeted warmly and sat down. We were well attended to the whole time even though our waiter had just been sat at least a 15 top. The small salad was more than enough for two and the house vinaigrette is delicious. My boyfriend preferred the Caesar.  And the personal pizza hit the spot I got the garden freak minus the Roma tomatoes. If you're looking for a great pizza place this is the one.

88r8zZA23WX_RaAlgjHyvg.text: Delicious pizza, excellent service and the Oreo cheesecake is AMAZING! I'd recommend this to anyone who wants authentic pizza.

-acas1iOfe2fzX_KAyXvKQ.text: Excellent brickoven pizza!. The sauce is delicious and the ingredients are very flavorful. The best thing about the pizza is that none of the ingredients overpower the others. Not too much cheese or sauce and plenty of toppings.   I work close to the one in El Segundo but never went. Now that I've gone, i'll be visiting the one near by more often.

photos.caption: Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside Grimaldis

CPwC2ZCcf9balK3YAeSYfg.text: Amazing pizzas, crust was perfect!! Service was great, pizzas came out quickly. Definitely go back when in Vegas again.

Pw9q7UdSVi4qcX4df3Fxbg.text: I was first drawn to the original Grimaldi's in Brooklyn a few years ago and since then, I've been returning to a number of their franchises both in Nevada and Florida. Known for their coal-fired brick ovens, the pizzas are great, but nothing like the first time I stepped into their Brooklyn storefront. Maybe it was the New York water or being cooked in that original over 100-year-old brick oven, but it was just better.   Grimaldi's has since then franchised out and I'm not sure if they even own that location in Brooklyn anymore. The pizza recipe and flavor is probably diluted a bit, but I love that familiar chewy crust. The ingredients are fresh and it definitely compares to any $15 fancy pizza that you may find in a hipster metropolitan restaurant. Although I love the classic margherita, the white sauce with garlic is also a nice option.

DtNVvyBDfIWJNfrUvX97mQ.text: We went there on April 11th for an early dinner 5:30pm - the pizza is really good thin crust very tasty. However, our waitress Melanie was really pushy and actually annoying - she pushed us to order like crazy- trying to sell more even there was absolutely no need - I started laughing when she asked one in our group if he wants another beer - he had just done one sip out of his glass!?  She really made us feel very uncomfortable - there are other good pizza places around here.. I can spend $200 somewhere else - maybe they let us enjoy our orders a bit more. People are making a difference..!

1IhBf-73GgLp05coK0dq1w.text: Pizza is great! Tried the bruschetta trio and even got the kids to eat it. Always happy when they try something different. Had the Margarita pizza, traditional mushroom and traditional pepperoni pizzas. Almost finished all three. So yummy, great New York style pizza! Even gave the boys pizza dough to play with while we waited for our food.

-G_cD14gvwSCoILL6yNqqA.text: Very good Pizza. Moved here In Vegas for good and this will be once a week thing now. Great atmosphere as well  We ordered mixed meat lover and veggies.  Perfectly made and perfect taste.  Was crowded but its Vegas and you will have to wait.  Will be there next week again with work group.

NaHqtRZujQwcYoveNkNFTA.text: Well, I was not that blown-away with the food but I had a great service. The ambiance was loud that if you were with someone you should speak a little louder than normal.  My server was friendly and spoke politely and with full attention to me and my friends. He quickly gave us our orders, thumbs up for that! But when we started to devour the food, we figure out that the food was just average and nothing to rave about. For its price, I think it was just lacking. Improvement I must say.

3pc6_5il945thx6f8Gmj2A.text: Came here for a quick lunch.  We were starving and figured we couldn't go wrong with pizza.  I've been to Grimaldi's in Hoboken numerous times and knew the food was good.    We ordered a small a Ceasar salad which was good.  Typical ceaser and we enjoyed it.  The small was more than enough for 2 people.  Then we ordered the margarita and Brooklyn bridge pizza.  The pizza was good but not as good as Hoboken.  The crust is thinner and less dough as the Hoboken location.    The food was good but since it wasn't as consistent or as good as the Hoboken location I gave it a 3.

ATtXNx37KBV4FEKadPLCZQ.text: Gluten Free review:  This is your quintessential pizzeria.  Red and White checkered tablecloths and bistro style seating.   Can you safely eat here gluten free?  Yes, probably.  They offer a gluten free crust, with the disclaimer about possible cross contamination.  How could they not: it's a pizzeria and the flour is everywhere.  I ordered the white pizza on the gf crust, with tomatoes and mushrooms.  It's was excellent.  After it cold, it wasn't as great, but it's a lot better than some gf pizzas I've had. GF crusts are only available 12 inch.  Which was fine.  Haha I ate all but one slice by myself.   My husband got a regular crust which was crispy and chewy at the same time-lots if bubbles and char.  He loved it.    For drinks I got the summer sangria.  Super yummy.    Service : other parties experienced a delay in getting served or even welcomed.  The problem could have been their particular server, or perhaps the manager, who was busily not helping out at all.  Not sure the story there but I would start there to address any problems.  Our waitress was attentive and pleasant.  All you could ask for.   Others didn't fare as luckily.

photos.caption: Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Summer Sangria (after I drank about 1/3 of it)
Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gluten Free Crust.  White Pizza, mushrooms and sliced tomatoes.

D3H99mxREdOj781BvYoxFw.text: Located in the second level of the Palazzo, this franchise did not live up to the hype for me personally, but I may have chosen the wrong dishes? We were seated promptly on a Friday night and our server was friendly.  This might be one of the few places where I think the salad was much better than the pizza. To start, my group tried both the Spinach Salad and Caesar Salad and liked both equally. The portions for the salads were generous for the price. There was a rouge hair we found in the Spinach Salad that the waitress replaced quickly, however.  For pizza, we opted for the 16" Traditional White Sauce which ultimately was not memorable. Although the pizza was hot, it did not taste fresh. We requested tomatoes and sausage as toppings which were fine. The 16" overall fed my party of three but none of us really wanted to head back afterward. If you do end up coming, maybe load up on a bunch of toppings (which incur an extra charge per topping).

XgV7Ynn4_AyH2jYXnv5aaw.text: I walked in and went to sit at the bar. The bartender was kind of a d*ck so I just ordered an appetizer. It is apparently weird to people if you don't order an alcoholic drink when in Las Vegas. When two loud obnoxious women came to sit next to me, I decided to move to a table. Luckily it came with a friendly server.  The trio of bruschetta was mediocre. I think this place is good for pizza but this was disappointing. The bread was not the best. I got the tomato-Parmesan topping which was ok, the mushroom topping which I would not order again, and the artichoke topping which was my favorite. Quick service but the experience was not that great. Lots of loud and drunk people, mixed with families. I don't know what was happening. I left and continued my dinner at another restaurant.

-d20FgUyf1zNGzwffAhi4g.text: I went to the original Grimaldi's once upon a time, waiting under the Brooklyn Bridge for half an hour in the freezing cold. It was nice to waltz into this Vegas location like it was any old pizza joint. Maybe this speaks to my lack of character, but I think pizza tastes just as good without the suffering.  We stopped in for a quick dinner last month on our way out of town. The place was pretty quiet at 6:00 on a Sunday, and we were able to get seated immediately. It was a casual spot with an easy vibe, with a few overt nods to its New York roots--subway signs and some black and white photos of the city. Service was mostly fine, though we did wait an unreasonably long time for our wine. We ordered a bottle of Candoni pinot noir right away, only to receive with our food twenty minutes later.  We shared a salad and a large pizza for dinner, and this was an appropriate amount of food for four people, especially at the tail end of a gluttonous weekend. The Caesar salad was good, with romaine lettuce, shaved Italian cheese, coal oven-baked croutons, and Caesar dressing. More importantly, the pizza hit the spot.  Grimaldi's base traditional pizza involves a secret recipe tomato sauce, hand-sliced mozzarella, basil, and a signature blend of cheese and spices. This all comes on a thin crust, nicely charred and bubbled up with heat from the oven. We got our pie topped half Margherita and half Brooklyn Bridge. The Margherita added extra sauce and fresh basil to the traditional pizza, the Brooklyn Bridge oven-roasted red peppers, creamy ricotta, and Italian sausage. I had two slices of the Brooklyn Bridge, and it was pretty delicious.  If you want New York-style pizza in Vegas, Grimaldi's is a solid bet. The food is tasty and you can leave the character-building conditions to the New Yorkers.

7RJEnOpwl6p5RHdO0vCkTg.text: Grimaldi's has always been on my list when I'm in New York, but the line is always around the block. I was excited that this location exists in Vegas. We dined in on what they call the "patio" which is really seating outside the bar that looks into the hotel. You can people watch while they shop. We originally ordered the large house salad to split but were talked into just ordering the small salad by our server. We were disappointed by the small salad as we could have both eaten that size ourselves. Minus one star for this recommendation.   We ordered the 16 inch don pizza. The pizza was pretty good; it had thin crust and the toppings and cheese were good. The pizza was a little too saucy for my liking and wish the crust was cooked slightly more.   For drinks, we ordered the stout and a red wine. It wasn't until after I was done with my wine that our server brought the more extensive wine menu. Where was this at the beginning of our meal when I asked for recommendations?! Too little, too late.  Food: 4/5 Service: 2/5

NMjJtFgzv20dB_jKsWW8wA.text: Pizza is what Grimaldi does best and boy do they deliver on taste and texture!   Towards the end of the evening, we had a taste for pizza and after seeing the rave reviews on Yelp, we decided to order takeout just to sample. Thank goodness we did! It's by far one of the best pizzas I've ever had hands down!   We got the Margherita pizza and jazzed it up with pepperonis, sausages, mushrooms and fresh basil to brightened it up with the splendid "house-blended tomato cream sauce" on a Perfect crispy crust! The pizza was out of this world Ah-mazing!   We had every intention of eating it at the hotel but, after a quick taste test it did not make it to its original destination. We devoured in along the way and finished it in the car. It was that Good!   The attached photo does not do it justice!   I highly recommend it for your pizza fix!

photos.caption: Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margherita with pepperoni, sausages, mushrooms and fresh basil! Delicious!
Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margherita with pepperoni, sausages, mushrooms and fresh basil! Delicious!

VElBfpRfadeDcs-OfiMxiA.text: There are loads of restaurants to pick from when visiting Las Vegas. I had read this place was a popular choice and since my buddies and I were craving pizza, we decided to come here.  Grimaldi's is located in the Palazzo Hotel on the strip. We took an Uber ride from Mandalay Bay Hotel around 10pm on a weekend summer evening and had no issues getting a table.  Actually, the restaurant was pretty quiet. The whole vibe at Grimaldi's certainly exudes Italian. I'd say it bordered on being slightly upscale for casual pizza dining.  For myself and my two friends, we decided to try the 18-inch (their largest sized pizza offered), THE DON, under the Chef's Pizza selections for $28. We were unsure about whether to get an appetizer or a 2nd pizza as we didn't know how much food would be suffice.  For The Don, the recipe consisted of a traditional pizza topped with Italian sausage, meatballs and pepperoni.   Here's where things got awkward and sort of disappointing for me....when we asked our server for a slight adjustment to the ingredients for our toppings, he said "no problem".  When we got our pizza shortly after ordering, it was delicious, we all enjoyed it. When we received our check, our server made a $3 adjustment for changing our pizza into a "half and half" pizza!  Essentially, we weren't even adding a topping, we were actually subtracting a topping by making the pizza into a half and half.   When we questioned the waiter about the change, he said there was a fee for making the pizza into a "half and half". That was sort of a shock for us, without warning.  Ya know, when you're in Vegas, I guess it's taken for granted that since you're immersed in money and gambling, fees are no big deal. Though it wasn't about the money, it was the principal of the whole thing.   Lol....it actually seemed like we were living in a Larry David story for Curb Your Enthusiasm or Seinfeld. We had never heard of a "half and half fee"....and we didn't see it mentioned on the menu either.  Most confusing is that our waiter argued with us about the fee instead of just letting it go. We were sort of laughing about the whole thing...being such a peculiar situation.  Regardless of our new understanding for a "half and half fee", my friends and I sort of had enough from our time at Grimaldi's and decided to leave even though we considered ordering another pizza because the food was good. One thing to mention....if you've ever eaten coal fired pizzas, they're normally thin crusted and not too filling where you can usually eat more than normal for pizzas like these. We should have ordered a 2nd pizza.  Finally, what was so unusual about our experience here was that our server showed no remorse or care for the fact we felt a little slighted. We were on vacation and we figured he'd give us the benefit of the doubt.  Although...he seemed pretty unapologetic for the whole instance. You'd think with prices at Grimaldi's being above average for pizzas, he'd work hard for his customers.  Oh well...although we had a lingering instance from our experience....the pizza was still fresh out of the oven crispy and tasty. I can't knock them for that.

photos.caption: Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. An 18&#34; - The Don Pizza w/ sausage, meatballs and pepperoni.  Remember, they charge a $3 half and half fee!
Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States

d6wk2WB0gw7todgzYU0FzA.text: Came here around 8:40pm on a Sunday night and we're able to get seated promptly. Ordered a Mediterranean salad, a white pizza with garlic + mushrooms and sausage. It came out first, and it was fantastic. The garlic flavor really shines and is definitely the best part of the pizza. I'm not sure if it was because of the mushrooms, but the center of the pizza was quite soggy.   Next came the Margherita and my personal favorite, especially if you're eating a later dinner like we were, it's very simple and you simply get to enjoy all the ingredients as they are. The bottom of the pizza was crispy throughout and brought me back to my first thin crust slice at some random spot in Brooklyn some time long ago. Sauce is excellent, basil was fresh, and the crust - amazing. Highly recommended to enjoy thin crust pizza au naturel without all the extra toppings getting in the way!  Sizes come in 12"/16"/18". 12 and 16 both come with 6 slices, but the 12" is like the size of your plate. Two 16" pizzas were enough to feed are party of 6 with the salad (so two slices each). Depending on the cuts you might get some uneven slices, so share accordingly.  Thanks Grimaldi's!

photos.caption: Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margherita
Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White with mushrooms and sausage

nYUbqEf-h3oGujFJhb1NUQ.text: My friend and I were hungry for pizza and work in the same mall so we thought we would try this place. I have been to grimaldis before at another location and it was pretty good. It was a Sunday late afternoon, it wasn't that busy.  We were seated right away. Both of us had different tastes so we went half and half on our medium pizza. The pizza came out hot, the vegetable toppings were fresh. I'm not a thin crust guy, but with their oven, it was crisp and blended in nicely with the toppings. Our waiter was attentive, and the decor is old school. The price is a bit high, but a good experience overall.

PDJgwdjEe3IVHU7-HxDyZw.text: Nestaha, a recent transplant from Arizona, was our server, and she was very nice, as well as attentive (refilled our drinks, checked in on us several times, boxed up our leftover pizza). She also had some suggestions though we've been to this popular pizza restaurant many times- it's just that this was our first time to this particular location. We actually got re-routed here, as there was a huge traffic jam on Spring Mountain- we were set to visit the Fashion Show location (the Strip and freeway ramps were shut down due to the VP's visit at the casino for a rally, which we did not know was taking place).    This location is pretty big (we've now been to three locations around the city). There is outside seating as well (well, it is outside of the restaurant, but still part of the shopping center, not really outside outside). The inside seating starts with the bar, which is at the front side, and then there is a long hallway of tables leading to the main dining area, which faces the front of the Palazzo shops building, and also the open kitchen (you can see the cooks prepare the pizza and place them into the oven- they kept making pies!). Our table faced the hallway with the side fronting the escalator (so we sort of had the fishbowl effect, seeing all the people go down the escalator---well, it was a two way street, good people-watching, hahaha). It's nice inside this one, the layout, I like it.  There were quite a few other diners, but because it is pretty spacious, it didn't seem to run out of room or get crowded (or get loud, with conversation, for that matter). We also recommended this place to my longtime friend who was visiting LV with her daughter. They visited the following night. They ordered the Dom without the meatballs.    Our son got to enjoy playing with the pizza dough presented on a pizza pan. We enjoyed the complimentary sliced bread, with the oil and balsamic vinegar, topped with black pepper. We got our favorite pizza, meatball pizza, thin crust, and like always, it was perfect. There was a good amount of cut meatballs, as you can see from my pics. Our son loves lots of extra cheese on it. I add some to my slices but I also add the crushed red pepper, too. For dessert, we got the Oreo Cheesecake (we split it three ways)- it is my favorite cheesecake because it is light and airy. I don't like the thick, dense sort of cheesecake.   It's our son's favorite pizza, so when we talk about pizza, he thinks we are always talking about Grimaldi's. He responds with: "Meatball Pizza- yay!" It's taken a while, but I was a huge fan of Metro Pizza's Gotham; after our last visit there (the pizza was a little soggy), I can honestly say that Grimaldi's is officially now my favorite pizza. (Years ago, I saw it on "Food Wars", too.)

photos.caption: Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oreo cheesecake
Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatball pizza
Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wine- on the wall

yKs_dcKxFFFBWe4-DlUrxA.text: We had a family lunch/early dinner midweek. We were seated quickly since we were in between rush times. The restaurant is kind of old school Italian style and a bit dark. Lots of space, looks like a good place to bring a group, as we did!   We ordered a few drinks, some pizzas and a large salad to share.  Our waitress was friendly and super attentive. My drink was delicious (watermelon mojito) and very strong. The pizzas were beautiful quality and perfectly crisp. We shared pepperoni and an arugula/prosciutto pizza between the 5 of us. We were looking for a lighter lunch and it was the perfect amount.  Def recommend this place at least during off hours, not sure how busy it'd be during peak. Great service, gorgeous pizza and fresh ingredients.

photos.caption: Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zrFy0tb5neVvxYHqa0udbQ.text: Decent pizzas. Good price. Great service. I used to live in NYC and loved grimaldis there. This one is not close. Sauce does not taste as good as NY, maybe its the water.   update: this review is for service only.  We walked in at 9 pm with a drink. We were staying at Palazzo.  Walking with a drink to Grimaldis is a mistake and the hostess made sure to tell us that. She didnt acknowledge us as we entered but made sure to take our drink and put in "on the side", she also said we are not Palazzo and a third party so we dont enforce Palazzo's rules here. Ok for a customer let me tell you this, your restaurant is "INSIDE" palazzo, so put a sign outside saying you are not Palazzo. But we overlooked that and then the bartender came to take our order, he was a total and a complete ahole to us. Very rude and does not belong in the servie industry. We walked out. Sorry but we are really not sorry.

VfDdTnlrmyguZriTqej_BA.text: To find this place, make like you are going to the Palazzo lobby then go upstairs. We only came here because they had gluten free options for our gluten free guest. We were very grateful they have gluten free pizza, though there is a note underneath on the menu that warns about cross contamination etc. but part of it said that not all toppings are gluten free. But the menu does not label which are or aren't. And when asking the waiter he replied with "I don't know" and that it isn't certified gluten free etc. it took a while for him to finally say he will ask his manager. There were only a couple toppings that were not gluten free: the spicy chicken sausage and the meatballs.  Cons: - we waited a really long time to be seated. There was no one in front of us and there were tables available but since the main seating person wasn't there we couldn't be seated even thought 2 other staff members asked us how many. - prices are steep, even for Vegas. 2 toppings were $2 and $3 each, and the toppings were sparse. SPARSE. I ended up scraping off toppings off of other slices just so I could at least have a couple slices with a decent amount of toppings on it. - the gluten free crust was just okay. It was crispy but flavor-wise was just okay - the gluten free guest felt really awkward asking which toppings were gluten free only to get the response "I don't know" from the waiter. What did they expect them to do? Just not get toppings?   Pros: - regular pizza was good  - looks like they are an equal opportunity employer

o3OFt7dZoP09y5RxSCir-A.text: Wow. Best pizza ever. Nothing else needs to be said. Crust is great. Extra fresh and done flawlessly. No need to go to any other pizza place. Wish it was in D.C.- wink wink

gUQ-SNVOzeoWR3WJtfhZiQ.text: After a long morning of shopping with the girls we had a fantastic lunch at Grimaldi's on the strip. Yes, the salads were fresh, plenty large and delicious and yes the pizza was a mouth pleaser as you would expect yet it was our server who stole the show. He knew the menu, recommended the perfect pies, and was funny and engaging. To top it off who brought out a special treat for our youngest daughters birthday.

photos.caption: Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NCAcH0zDw9M0_oKh-BXAEw.text: A bit in a corner in the palazzo but worth the walk.  Parking is super easy even for an out of towner  The small salads are good to share for two to three people.   We got 1 large mushroom ricotta. (Omg ricotta!!) and a medium pepperoni.  They use the small pepperoni that gets crunchy!! Heaven!! This fed all 5 of us.  It's so good we could have taken some home but kept eating Prices are fair and food comes quickly We were there at lunch on a Saturday so I can't say about speed at dinner.   But this place is a find for sure!

o0oWvpUxH7ZHRvl9vq-0lQ.text: So our friend brought a group of us to Grimaldi's. He said every time he's in Vegas he makes it a point to dine here. I was very pleasantly surprised with my first bite of the pizza. There were seven of us and we shared 3 large pizzas. (Pepperoni & Italian sausage, pepperoni & cheese, and pepperoni, sausage, mushrooms & jalapenos) Two of the guys were from the east coast and they even said it was the best pie they ever tasted. I enjoyed the pizza with a Caesar salad and the red house wine. I was in food heaven for the time we were there. I even ordered a pizza to go and ate some the next day. It was wonderful even cold! We will definitely make it a point to dine in every time we visit Vegas. Bon Appetite to the 10th degree!

photos.caption: Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All the pizzas looked delicious!

uGrtoWcfe98i6lyVqDFlww.text: The only problem with this place is that it is a 5 1/2 hour plane ride away.  The brick oven pizza is incredible. We got pepperoni and meatball toppings. The sauce is really good.    I need to copy their sauce and dough recipe for home use :).

VUzuR4G8k8ES8M6dxuRXMQ.text: Exvellent service, ambience.  Classic gingham tablecloths - no frills pizza.  Makes a lot of Palazzo joynts look $teep and pretentious.  No kids menu but any easy to understand menu, simple pricing and very capable servers!! Open kitchen always a plus and some family salads w flavorful produce for four are $10-16!!

9Y5DcfwC3oX5auU0Xt_UaA.text: So yummy!  Just like it's original & first Grimaldi restaurant in Brooklyn, NY!  Service was great!  Pizza was so delicious!  If you crave NY pizza, this is the place to go!  Highly recommend!

VcYAwMHdY3U_mCeMiE78Nw.text: This is one of the best pizzas ever. As anyone from a pizza city knows, they gotta get the whole thing right. Grimaldi's crust is perfect, the tomato sauce has just the right flavor, and the toppings are top notch. You can smell this place the moment you enter the Palazzo building or turn the corner from the shops, and I'm very happy to say it's as good as it smells, maybe even better. Never have to wait to be seated, with fast and friendly service. We always have to hit Grimaldi's when in Vegas, and it's ruined us for any other pizza. Go, you'll love it.

SSUT-4gMcsy_ZadFO5i0sA.text: This place was everything I was hoping it would be. I got the plain cheese pizza, because that's what you order to get a real feel for the taste of a pizza. It did not disappoint. The outside of the crust was nice and crispy, yet the inside remained delightfully chewy. Nicely seasoned sauce, had a slight sweetness to it. Absolutely phenomenal. Definitely lived up to the hype.

photos.caption: Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Firestone DBA on tap

7Fd9oxQDcar7in9xtiRpuw.text: OK. So, this is the best pizza west of the Mississippi river. Thank you for opening a store in LA!!!!!! Its a 100 min drive to the LA location.  Its so good that my 4 daughters ask me to drive there a couple times a month!!!! Thank you!!!!!!!!!!!! Tim and Anna

6y8u7fzA7lISGwPyHYHZ0g.text: One of the best pizza pies!!! If you can't have it in New York and your in Las Vegas definitely go here for pizza. The pizza is so delicious.  They use Buratta cheese and the crust is perfect.  The toppings are not an over kill.  Just great pizza.  However this location is in the mall but why not.  It's Vegas.

sLjxQjEOqqhJHbpJOh1YkQ.text: Awesome New York style pizza. Service was good. That's pretty much all I have to say! Would definitely go back.

gXyxKaGVGUjaZ_fWaLJPrw.text: Found them on 10 best cheap eats Vegas... It had great reviews by my fellow yelpers!  Yelpers great job reviewing this pizzeria!!!  I have to say, the pizza was excellent!    We shared a Ceaser salad, yummy.  Just like the way I like it crisp lettuce, cold out of the fridge, baked croutons with fresh shaved Parmesan cheese.  We just wanted to get a small bite, got the small (their version of medium) traditional pizza.  The sauce and cheese were good, but it's the thin crust dough that's sooooo good!  Suggestion;  Don't use the Parmesan cheese that's on the table but ask for the fresh shaved Parmesan.  The place is nicely decorated and has a cool vibe.  The reason I gave it 4 stars; our waitress forgot our waters, forgot to bring croutons that we asked on the side, and we had to ask twice for our check.   C'mon it's a service job if you can't get the order right at least bring the check on time...  Just keepin' it real The Real Foodie

7UQSZXgNSRYkXdMQwFH1Og.text: Amazing!!!! Fresh cheese!!!- Authentic.   The service was fast. The pizza couldn't have been anymore perfect. Real slices of fresh mozzarella cheese. Create your own pizza with so many toppings. The meatballs were the best.

VmcoFH24BPHwAK1rlRE6jA.text: Omg the pizza was delicious. The service was great. The ambiance is very casual and easy going.  I would definetly come back here. Descently priced!

wzJW57kNZ0F6q1qNSUmKdg.text: I think this is my new go-to place for cheap eats when I'm in vegas. The food here is delicious and the price is perfect.   We got a pizza, salad, appetizer, and drinks for less than $20/person. Where else can you get that much food for that price when dining on the strip? The great thing is that you can also build your own pizza.   Service here was a bit slow at times, but our server was great when he was actually tending to our table.   Definitely going back.

ZCjQtbdVBLYHKsgu3Jd7lw.text: This is my third time here and Grimaldi's has to be the best thin crust pizza I've ever had.  And I've earn A LOT of pizza.  The sauce is just the right blend of tasty but not too overpowering. The crust is crunchy and done just right - brown but not burnt. The toppings all complement each other (I tried pepperoni, Italian sausage and black olives tonight). The service is very good. Prices are reasonable for Vegas. And I like the "outdoor" seating in the mall. Or you can sit indoors. I might try another pizza place in Vegas. Or I might not bother.  It's that good here.

photos.caption: Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pepperoni, sausage and black olives personal size pizza.

UqOApbD1FPjJQg4EqD3wyA.text: As this is one of my favorite meals in New York every time I visit, when I saw this on this side of the country (and just discovered another one opening in El Segundo later this year!!), I HAD to go. The waitress said that everything is the exact same as the one in Brooklyn, even down to the water they use for the dough. So you customize your own pizza and can make it a personal size or share with others. For 2 ppl, the large (18" for $16 + $2-4 per topping) is a pretty good size that gives you 6-8 slices. All I can say is GET THE RICOTTA CHEESE. Seriously. The waitress also highly recommended the new amaretto cheesecake as well... good luck trying to save stomach room for that! Thus my review of the original Brooklyn location holds the same for this location (except for the 45 min wait since this location is much bigger): yelp.com/biz/grimaldis-b... 1 Front St Brooklyn, NY 11201 (718) 858-4300 11/28/2009 "The best New York pizza I've ever had! Being a California girl, I've still managed to make my way to Grimaldi's twice this year and even waited in the 45 minute long line to get into the door. The wait was definitely worth the fresh, doughy, thin crusted pizza with an array of toppings to delight your taste buds. I think the first time I went, we ordered mushrooms, sun dried tomatoes, and ricotta on our pizza. The second time we ordered basil, sun dried tomatoes, and sausage. Both times the pizza wasn't too oily or too cheesy, and the chewy sun dried tomatoes gave the texture an extra kick. And despite my friends and I eating the entire large pizza, we still walked out without the bloated, heavy feeling. Excellent."

hB5BoNO6RsoX5rEbPL_IdQ.text: Wow.  Talk about pizza.  This place lived up to the standards set by NYC.  The crust is chewy, thin, light, and the only thing making it "thick" is what you choose top it with.  We had a red pie, and a white pie...Both loaded up with tons of ingredients and flavors bursting our palettes.   Nice place to have in the middle of Las Vegas within the Canal Shops.

photos.caption: Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_Ei_WapSbPcPFRAT5QCPPg.text: Small pizza is good for 4 adults. Very reasonable price especially inside Palazzo Hotel. Came here after New Year's Eve party, 1:30am. They closed at 2am by the way. The server looks very tired but he still gave us good service. The Pepperoni Pizza was delicious, NY style, very thin and juicy. The sangria was very good and fruity flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Grimaldi's Pizzeria - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Late night pizza craving?!Open until 2am

tWkv490d4FyPx5mtSq03Gw.text: The best pizza east of NJ. Fresh ingredients. Not greasy at all. The crust was very crispy. Delicious with a carafe of wine.

n-HfI-kIGU6VlQwIae2WCA.text: Great pizza!!and we also enjoyed the Caprese salad.  We ordered the small pizza... Mozzarella, Kalamata olives and pepperoni and it was sooo good!!nice ambience in the Palazzo hotel.  The reason a three star is because they did not have much beers on tap, the beers were offered in menu, just weren't available when asked for them.  But the food was great.
